title: 15 most anticipated games of 2025 that you need to add to your wishlist
description: See if your games are on the wishlist this year.
author: Dylan Turck

text: Steam Sign in to your XDA account 2025 is shaping up to be an action-packed year for gamers, with tons of great games in the works by some of the biggest franchises in the industry. Whether you're a fan of RPGs, FPS, or anything in between, you're sure to find some great titles to play this year. While we have a ton of new games that have been announced, not all of them are slated to be released this year. So, for this list we are arranging the titles in order of release date, but keep in mind that many of them will not have dates set in stone. And as always, in the video game industry, delays may occur and some titles may be pushed back by a few months, a year, or possibly even further. Related 6 horror game franchises that will give you nightmares If you are looking for reasons to keep yourself awake at night, make sure you play these six horror game franchises that are pure nightmare fuel 15 Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 February 4th 2025 The original Kingdom Come: Deliverance was a real shot in the dark by Warhorse Studios, and it really paid off. Placing you in a beautifully handcrafted version of Bohemia with historically accurate weapons and realistic combat scenarios. The game really captures what it must have felt like to live in the 14th century. Continuing the story of Henry of Skalitz, you must siege castles, fight off bandits, and wage wars for king and for country. The sequel has refined the combat system of the first game by simplifying the directional combat and introducing new weapons for players to use. They have also added new combat finishers, better stealth mechanics, and a better skill tree. There are also new survival mechanics which will have you cleaning clothes, smithing weapons and tools, collecting ingredients for alchemy and cooking food to eat. Kingdom Come: Deliverance II Kingdom Come: Deliverance II is an exhilarating Action RPG, set amidst the chaos of a civil war in 15th Century Bohemia. From bustling city streets to lush forests, explore this open-world Medieval Europe through an unforgettable adventure filled with action, thrills, and wonder. 14 Sid Meier's Civilization VII February 11th 2025 Civilization VII is the newest entry to Sid Meier's franchise, and it introduces a lot of new mechanics and changes to shake up the gameplay formula. While the core mechanics of choosing a civilization, bringing war or peace, and advancing through different ages remain the same. The game brings some major changes which will either be loved or hated by dedicated Civilization fans. There are only three ages now: the age of antiquity, discovery, and then the modern era. Your leader has the ability to choose different civilizations at the start of each new age. The diplomacy system has also been reworked. They introduced crisis events, removed bandits, and changed how your troops navigate across the map with commanders. Sid Meier's Civilization VII In Civilization VII, your strategic decisions shape the unique cultural lineage of your evolving empire. Rule as one of many legendary leaders from throughout history and steer the course of your story by choosing a new civilization to represent your empire in each Age of human advancement. 13 Monster Hunter Wilds February 28th 2025 Monster Hunter Wilds is the newest mainline game in the Monster Hunter series. After Monster Hunter Worlds’ well received launch, fans have been eagerly waiting for the next major entry in the series. Featuring a living breathing ecosystem and brand-new monsters to fight, the game is also bringing back mounts for easier exploration around the even larger open world. Monster Hunter Wilds still has the same 14 weapon types, but it will focus on refining its gameplay instead of adding new weapons. An improved version of the slinger will be making its return, which was first added in Monster Hunter Worlds. The core gameplay remains the same, revolving around you hunting monsters in the world and then using the resources you gathered to craft new weapons and hunt even more powerful monsters. But not everything is the same because the game makes some big changes to the series in this title. Like being able to carry a secondary weapon on your mount, allowing you to switch on the fly. Giving monsters more weak points by adding wounds and focus mode. Monster packs and pack alphas also make it more difficult to fight monsters one on one. Dynamic weather changes make different monsters show up. And offline players can now summon NPC hunters to fight alongside them if a monster proves to be too difficult for them. Monster Hunter Wilds Fulfill your duty as a Hunter by tracking and defeating powerful monsters and forging strong new weapons and armor from the materials you harvest from your hunt as you uncover the connection between the people of the Forbidden Lands and the locales they inhabit. 12 Split Fiction March 6th 2025 split-fiction-1.jpg Hazelight Studios is at it again, single-handedly bringing the couch co-op genre back from the dead. While many developers shy away from couch co-op games, Hazelight embraces them, and continues to deliver fun games with unique stories and complex mechanics as found with their previous games; A Way Out and It Takes Two. Split Fiction has a similar gameplay style to It Takes Two, but instead of playing as a married couple, in turmoil and nearing divorce. You play as a pair of sci-fi and fantasy authors who are thrown into a combined story of their writings. Together the authors must work alongside each other and use both sci-fi and fantasy elements to finish the story and return home. If you're looking for a game to play with a friend or significant other, then this title would be a great choice. Split Fiction Mio and Zoe are contrasting writers who become trapped in their own stories after being hooked up to a machine designed to steal their creative ideas. To escape with their minds intact, they’ll need to overcome their differences to crash the system that holds them, uncovering secrets and personal struggles hidden within their own fiction. 11 Assassin's Creed Shadows March 20th 2025 Assassin's Creed Shadows is a game that AC fans have been begging for, for years. Set in Feudal Japan, you can play two different characters, Naoe and Yasuke. This seems to be an attempt by Ubisoft to merge the gameplay elements from the original games with the combat-focused RPG nature of the more recent titles. Each playable character has a different style of gameplay, with Naoe being a shinobi. She has a more stealthy approach to combat, and her play style is reminiscent of the earlier Assassin's Creed titles, running on rooftops, setting up traps, and stealthily assassinating targets from the shadows. Whereas Yasuke is a samurai and acts more like a tank or brute from the later games, giving you an up-close and in-your-face combat experience. Assassin's Creed Shadows Experience an epic historical action-adventure story set in feudal Japan! Become a lethal shinobi Assassin and a powerful legendary samurai as you explore a beautiful open world in a time of chaos. 10 Doom: The Dark Ages May 15th 2025 After the triumphant return of Doom in 2016, fans were eagerly waiting to see how the series would evolve in the new age of gaming. Soon after, we were all gifted Doom Eternal, which took what the original title had and built on it to make it even better. And now, Doom returns with the franchise’s latest title, Doom: The Dark Ages. With the new entry to the franchise, it is shaking up the formula, swapping out its futuristic environment for a medieval one, while still keeping the gameplay and mechanics that made Doom (2016) so great. In this prequel, the weapon roster has completely changed, swapping out your futuristic weapons for more medieval-esque ones, featuring a shield with a chainsaw, a mace, a musket-looking shotgun, a spike gun and the one most fans are excited about, the Skull Crusher gun. Doom Slayer is back again, sending the hordes of hell back to whence they came. This time you are used as a weapon, not by the UAC, but instead by kings and gods. Given access to an Atlan suit and a dragon mount that you can fly around on, you must slaughter your way across the armies of hell in this grittier, darker, more archaic take on the Doom franchise. DOOM: The Dark Ages DOOM: The Dark Ages is the latest entry in the decorated first-person shooter franchise and the follow-up to DOOM Eternal. The story will cover the Doom Slayer's origin. 9 Mafia: The Old Country Summer 2025 After being spoiled by three fantastic remakes of the original Mafia games, never could we have imagined that we would be getting a brand-new prequel to the series as well. With the series taking us further back in time than we've been before, introducing horseback riding and showing off in early 20th century cars, players are sure to love this cinematic masterpiece. Mafia: The Old Country follows the protagonist Enzo Favara as he rises through the ranks of the Torrisi crime family. Travel back in time to the old country, set in the 1900's Sicily, as you enter the dark and gritty underworld of organized crime as an initiate in the mafia. Mafia: The Old Country Uncover the origins of organized crime in Mafia: The Old Country, a gritty mob story set in the brutal underworld of 1900s Sicily. Fight to survive as Enzo Favara and prove your worth to the Cosa Nostra in this immersive third-person action-adventure set during a dangerous, unforgiving era. 8 Borderlands 4 Summer 2025 Borderlands has returned after a poorly received movie tie-in, and the game series has released its newest mainline game. Moving away from Pandora and featuring a new cast of vault hunters, Borderlands 4 places us on a new planet and following a new story line. In Borderlands 4 you will have four new playable characters to choose from, and while the class types will still be the same, their powers will be very different. The game's combat system is getting a shakeup with better traversal with the new grappling system. And as with every new installment, there will be a plethora of new guns to use and a ton of different enemies to fight. Borderlands 4 See if you have what it takes to go down in history as a legendary Vault Hunter as you search for secret alien treasure, blasting everything in sight. 7 Dying Light: The Beast Summer 2025 One of the best announcements we received during Gamescom 2024 was Dying Light: The Beast. After Techland’s release of Dying Light 2, many fans were confused as to what happened to the fan favorite protagonist, Kyle Crane from the original game. But that all changes with the newest entry to the series. Kyle Crane is back and, after being experimented on for years, he has finally escaped and is now half man and half beast. His only goal is to exact vengeance on those who had turned him into this monster. Using his newfound zombie powers along with his combat and parkour experience from the original games, is sure to create a gameplay loop that fans won't be able to get enough of. Dying Light: The Beast Dying Light: The Beast is a thrilling standalone zombie adventure set in the post-apocalyptic Castor Woods, a once-popular tourist destination. After 13 years of enduring experiments, you escape and hunt down your captors to seek retribution, only to discover there’s far more at stake. 6 Fable TBA 2025 First announced in 2020 and scheduled for release in 2025, after nearly a year without a real mainline game, Fable is finally being rebooted. A lot of gamers have fond memories of the original Fable games, but after Fable 3, a lot of fans trailed off from the series and felt disheartened by the direction the franchise had taken. Fable (2025) looks to be a true successor to the original games, taking us back to the world of Albion. The game brings back many of the things that fans loved about the originals, like the dry British humor, evil villains, heroic champions, and a world filled with beauty and magic. Fable (2025) Fable is an RPG developed by Playground Games and published by Microsoft. Set in Albion, the game challenges players to define what it means to be a hero. 5 Subnautica 2 TBA 2025 Subnautica is a survival action adventure game that follows the player after they have crash-landed on an alien planet that is covered in oceans with very few landmasses. The previous Subnautica games follow this same formula and have you collecting resources, crafting tools and building bases in order for you to survive the harsh alien environments you are stranded in. The fully underwater element of the game is a unique environment that few games have come close to replicating. Making Subnautica a special game for many survival enthusiasts. Constantly monitoring your oxygen, scavenging for resources, exploring underwater cave systems and steering clear of predatory creatures adds a lot of tension to the game and will keep you on edge as you explore the world and ultimately try to find a way to return home. Subnautica 2 Subnautica 2 is an underwater survival adventure game set on an all-new alien ocean world. It is the next chapter in the Subnautica universe, developed by Unknown Worlds. 4 Death Stranding 2 TBA 2025 Death Stranding is the brainchild of Hideo Kojima, the mastermind behind the Metal Gear Solid franchise. After a disagreement with Konami on the direction of the IP, Kojima decided to go his own way and create a new Studio, with its first flagship title, Death Stranding. While many argue that Death Stranding was more akin to a UPS simulation game than a traditional game. The strange story, interesting world, and unique gameplay mechanics left many gamers unable to put down their controllers. And while we don't know much about the story yet, we do know that we’ll be playing again as Sam Porter Bridges (played by Norman Reedus) as he continues to connect cities across the UCA. Death Stranding 2: On the Beach Death Stranding 2 is the continuation of Komija's Death Stranding franchise, bringing back a familiar face in Sam Porter (played by Norman Reedus). The release looks to continue the story surrounding the courier and the many dangers the Chiral Network faces. 3 Elden Ring: Nightreign TBA 2025 After Elden Ring received its first major DLC installment, Shadow of the Erdtree, earlier last year, fans never would have suspected that there was an entirely new game in the works as well. But soon after the DLC launched, FromSoftware announced that they were working on a spin-off for the franchise. Only this time, you don't have to fight it alone. Elden Ring: Nightreign introduces a new story, a procedurally generated world, the ability to play co-op, and adds an interesting rouge-like gameplay loop to the already great Elden Ring formula. In this game, you won't be able to create your own character; instead, you will choose between eight different hero types. The main gameplay loop revolves around you and up to two others working together to fight off enemies and level up with the ultimate goal of surviving three nights and three days, leading you to your final objective, to fight and kill the Night King. After every day, the map will become increasingly smaller as your time slowly runs out. Elden Ring Nightreign Elden Ring Nightreign is a standalone adventure within the Elden Ring universe, crafted to offer players a new gaming experience by reimagining the game’s core design. 2 Ghost of Yōtei TBA 2025 Ghost of Tsushima was one of the best new IPs from PlayStation in recent memory and after its success, we all knew a sequel was almost guaranteed. But we didn't expect one over 300 years later, in a new region and playing as a different protagonist. In Ghost of Yōtei, you play Atsu, presumably a Ronin, traveling around the region of Mount Yotei in Ezo (current day Hokkaido) and, after tragedy strikes, she must now dawn the title of ghost. While the previous entry focused on the first Mongolian invasion of Japan, the sequel will more likely focus on the expansion of the Japanese empire under the rule of the Tokugawa shogunate during the Edo period. The inclusion of dual-wielding katanas and the addition of era-appropriate firearms are sure to shake up the combat mechanics that fans of the original loved so much. Ghost of Yotei The sequel to Ghost of Tsushima, Ghost of Yōtei is a PS5 exclusive taking place in 1603, the story will feature a new protagonist and a new Japanese region that is far removed from Tsushima's setting. 1 Grand Theft Auto 6 Fall 2025 Grand Theft Auto V is one of the most popular AAA games on the market, having sold close to 200 million copies, it is considered the third best-selling game of all time, surpassed only by Minecraft and Tetris. And there’s no doubt in our minds that Grand Theft Auto VI will surpass its predecessor in every way imaginable. So much so, that the franchise has caused other publishers to not give solid release dates for their games, as to not be unknowingly crushed by the behemoth on launch. Grand Theft Auto VI returns you to Vice City, and much like the previous game, you are given multiple playable characters to play as, two to be exact. The two main characters in question are Lucia and Jason, a couple that go on a crime spree akin to that of Bonnie & Clyde. Although Rockstar has been very quiet on the details so far, one thing’s for certain, GTA 6 is shaping up to be the biggest release of the year. Grand Theft Auto 6 Grand Theft Auto 6 is an open world crime game that takes fans back to the neon-soaked streets of Vice City. 2025 is going to be a great year for gaming There is no doubt that we are going to have our hands full with all these great releases this year. While 2024 already had some great game releases, we also had our fair share of video game blunders that were swept under the rug. So let's hope that we don't have to experience that again and that the developers behind these games are going to make 2025 one for the record books. Fall 2025

Grand Theft Auto V is one of the most popular AAA games on the market, having sold close to 200 million copies, it is considered the third best-selling game of all time, surpassed only by Minecraft and Tetris. And there’s no doubt in our minds that Grand Theft Auto VI will surpass its predecessor in every way imaginable. So much so, that the franchise has caused other publishers to not give solid release dates for their games, as to not be unknowingly crushed by the behemoth on launch.

Grand Theft Auto VI returns you to Vice City, and much like the previous game, you are given multiple playable characters to play as, two to be exact. The two main characters in question are Lucia and Jason, a couple that go on a crime spree akin to that of Bonnie & Clyde. Although Rockstar has been very quiet on the details so far, one thing’s for certain, GTA 6 is shaping up to be the biggest release of the year.

Grand Theft Auto 6

Grand Theft Auto 6 is an open world crime game that takes fans back to the neon-soaked streets of Vice City.

2025 is going to be a great year for gaming

There is no doubt that we are going to have our hands full with all these great releases this year. While 2024 already had some great game releases, we also had our fair share of video game blunders that were swept under the rug. So let's hope that we don't have to experience that again and that the developers behind these games are going to make 2025 one for the record books.
